alert.note: Non-Weather Emergency Message. Not sent to IPAWS.

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued March 23 at 12:40AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
The South Carolina Department of Environmental Services in Columbia SC has issued a Code Orange Fine Particulates Action Day for northern Spartanburg County, and the mountains of Greenville and Pickens Counties in of South Carolina, until noon EDT today.
!**FOR SC ONLY, Insert brief description of conditions contributing to action day**!A code orange Air Quality Alert means that the fine particulate concentrations within the specified areas may approach or exceed unhealthy standards for individuals sensitive to particulate pollution due to local wildfire smoke, mainly along and north of SC Highway 11.
South Carolina DES recommends that individuals with respiratory health issues limit time spend outdoors and/or move all activities indoors to avoid the smoke or fine particulates. Keep windows and doors closed. Run an air conditioner if you have one but keep the fresh-air intake closed and the filter clean to prevent outdoor smoke and fine particulates from getting inside.
For more information about fine particulates, please visit: https://fire.airnow.gov.

parameter.value: AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY

area.areaDesc: Pickens Mountains; Greenville Mountains; Northern Spartanburg
